title: 104_hr1534
content: The curr_chunk is a section titled "EXTENSION OF EXPIRING AUTHORITIES OF DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS." The curr_chunk discusses amendments to various sections of title 38, United States Code, extending deadlines for outpatient services, contract authority for alcohol and drug abuse care, and nursing home care alternatives for veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is required to submit a report to Congress on the medical efficacy and cost effectiveness of these changes by March 31, 1996. The curr_chunk discusses amendments to sections of title 38, United States Code, extending deadlines for housing assistance for homeless veterans and health scholarships program. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a report to Congress on the program's operation and costs by March 31, 1997. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must report to Congress by March 31, 1997, on the health scholarships program's impact on employee retention. Deadlines for housing assistance for homeless veterans have been extended to December 31, 1997. The Compensated Work Therapy and Therapeutic Transitional Housing Program under Public Law 102-54 is amended to remove a specific time frame and set a sunset date of December 31, 1997. The authority to make grants to Veterans Memorial Medical Center in the Philippines is repealed under Section 1732 of title 38, United States Code. Additionally, authorization for major medical construction projects for fiscal year 1996 is granted. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs is authorized to carry out major medical facility projects and leases for the Department of Veterans Affairs in fiscal year 1996. $224.8 million is authorized for projects and $2.79 million for leases. Projects can only be funded using appropriations from fiscal year 1996. The Department of Veterans Affairs is authorized to use funds for Construction, Major Projects, and activities not specific to a project.
